item.title: Experiences
item.description:
Sep. 2020 – present:

Ph.D. candidate of Marine Geochemistry, School of Earth Sciences and Engineering, Nanjing University, Nanjing, China

Sep. 2016 – Jun. 2020:

Bachelor of Geochemistry, School of Earth Sciences and Engineering, Nanjing University, Nanjing, China

Sep. 2013 – Jun. 2016:

(Senior middle school) Zhengzhou Foreign Language School, Zhengzhou, China

item.title: Hobbies
item.description:
Music

I enjoy exploring a variety of music genres, with indie-pop, alternative rock, and jazz hip-hop being my favorites. Here’s a playlist of 10 songs that best capture my musical personality: JZ’s Playlist.

I can also play several instruments, including acoustic guitar, bass, drums, and the guzheng, a traditional Chinese instrument.

Sports

I play tennis, pickleball and love watching tennis matches as well. My favorite players include Qinwen Zheng, Iga Swiatek, Coco Gauff, and Rafa Nadal.

item.title: Publications
item.description:
2024

Yang, X., Li, T., Chen, T., Zheng, J., & Li, W. (2024). Incorporation of Al into diatom frustule as a proxy of seawater Al/Si ratios in the Antarctic Zone of the Southern ocean: Implications for surface silicic acid concentrations during the last glacial period. < Quaternary Science Reviews > URL

2023

T. Chen, J. Zheng, T. Li, X. Shi, L. F. Robinson, M. Wang, G. Li, H. Ling, X. Ren, J. Ji, Thorium isotope evidence for glacial–interglacial dust storminess and productivity in the North Pacific gyre. <Geochim. Cosmochim. Acta.> URL

Hi there, I’m Jianfan, a PhD candidate of marine geochemistry. Welcome to my site!

My current works focus on:

Marine variations during orbital and millennial climate changes.

  • Quantifying the lithogenic dust flux input to the ocean by U-Th isotopes.
  • Reconstruction of paleo ocean circulation by Pa/Th.
  • Exploring the impact of iron-fertilization on marine productivity.

The burial patterns of components and elements at the seawater-sediment interface.

  • Looking into the budgets and burial mechanisms of various elements (such as: Fe, Mn, Co, Ni, Cu, Zn) to the seafloor.
  • Investigating the kinetics of solute transportation at the seafloor through constraints from U-Th isotopes.

In my spare time l enjoy music, sports and writing.
